I like having the ability to provide a name,...but I'm sure there would be some that wouldn't want to go through the effort of naming each test variation.  How difficult would it be to provide both interfaces?

two cents,

-------------- Original message -------------- 
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> I'd forgot about this. One of the key points of having a testName in the
> Parameterized Test Case pattern is to solve this very problem, but
> giving each row of input/expected output data a name. I imagine adding a
> name is not that hard.
>
> @Parameters data = new Object[][] { {"testZero", 0, 5}, ... }
>
> I don't know about autoboxing works in Java, so that might be wrong.

Autoboxing seems to have no troubles with this:

@Parameters Object[][] data = { {"testZero", 0, 0}, {"testOne", 1, 1} };

What do y'all think about the extra name parameter?  Should it be required?

    David Saff
